intro: Hedlundia thuringiaca, commonly known as the Thuringian hedlundia, is a rare flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, umbel-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in calcareous soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in many regions.
